channel.title: Adding Shops

item.title: Adding Shops
item.dc:creator: @kneistol kneistol
item.description:
@kneistol wrote:

  1. Autospawn.cfg, should be where the rest of your configuration files are.

  2. go to ur client.java in the source and search zeke go down until the end off the sellers and make a new one like this

                             [code]} else if (NPCID == 541) { //Zeke
 			PutNPCCoords = true;
 			WanneShop = 24; //Al-Kharid Scimitar Shop
 		} else if (NPCID == npc id) { //Name off the shop
 			PutNPCCoords = true;
 			WanneShop = wanneshop id; //Examine the shop

[/code]

                                                                                           here put the npc id

like now am i gonna explain what they are } else if (NPCID == npc id) { //Name off the shop
PutNPCCoords = true;
WanneShop = wanneshop id; //Examine the shop
wanneshop id is simpel just go to ur shop.cfg and look at the shop id and just type one letter highter than the last one

  1. shops.cfg copy a line and add it under and paste the wanneshop id that u have putted into client.java and then just change the item and how many it is off them

  2. to change the prize go to item.cfg and search for the item id and then the three first lines is the prize
    the three lines is how much it costs, low alch and high alch idk wich one

hope this helped and if u dont get what i say just say so
il be gladly to explain one more time

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Shops
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

Sell = How much you sell it for, Buy = how much you buy it for Amount = how many are in stock and Item = the item ID(whip = 4151 etc)

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Shops
item.dc:creator: @Hunter_74 Hunter_74
item.description:
@Hunter_74 wrote:

//-----ShopID—ShopName----------------------------------------Sell----Buy-----Item----Amount–Item----Amount

Thats how my shop.cfg works.

It doesnt show much it costs, just what item and how many of it

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Shops
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

  1. Autospawn.cfg, should be where the rest of your configuration files are.
  2. First click on NPC, forget which case it is, search the client class for the case or something else that uses it like a banker, or if you have a new file for it look in there.
  3. shops.cgf or something like that, has all your shops in it, should be easy to work out once in there.
  4. also in shops.cfg, format is something like:

ShopID Shop Name Item Amount Cost Item Amount Cost

and so on…

Read full topic
